title: [Large-Scale] Designing Differential Education Using an Ontosemiotic Approach: Focusing on Solving Real-World Economic Problems

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics (Calculus I) and understanding of economic concepts
context.additional_context: Learners interact with digital tools using personal devices (tablets/laptops) and apply differential calculus concepts within economic problem-solving contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can apply differential calculus rules (tangent lines, derivative calculations) to solve real-world economic problems (e.g., profit maximization, cost minimization)
Learners can geometrically analyze function graphs and interpret the meaning of derivatives
Learners enhance decision-making skills by modeling marginal functions (revenue, cost) and optimization problems through differentiation
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
